means: 使聋( deafen的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The noise of the typewriters deafened her.
sentence.Network_cn: 打字机的噪声吵得她什么都听不见。

sentence.Network_en: A hard blow on the ear deafened him for life.
sentence.Network_cn: 耳朵上挨的一记猛击使他耳聋了一辈子.

RelatedPhrase.word: A deafening sound of gongs and drums

list.key: A deafening sound of gongs and drums
list.abs: 翻译词典... ... A deafening sound of gongs and drums 锣鼓喧天 Echo transmittance of sound pressure 往复透过率.

entry.tran: 震（或吵）得…听不见其他声音
entry.def: If a noise deafens you, it is so loud that you cannot hear anything else at the same time.

example.ex: The noise of the typewriters deafened her.
example.tran: 打字机的噪声吵得她什么都听不见。

entry.def: If you are deafened by something, you are made deaf by it, or are unable to hear for some time.

example.ex: He was deafened by the noise from the gun.

means.word_mean: 1. caused to hear poorly or not at all

auth_sentence.content: You gave everyone a scare, she said, loudly, as if his illness had also deafened him.

auth_sentence.content: As Jen prepared to fire her first shot, I backed off for fear of being deafened by the blast.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: As Jen prepared to fire her first shot, I backed off for fear of being deafened by the blast.
